page.title: 06A day at Cliffe Hill Quarry
page.content: The earliest a{workman}starts is 4.30am and others arrive up to 6.30am. They work through the day until 3.30pm or later depending upon the time they started work,and have 30 minutes to eat their dinner which they take at 12.30. { Wages}vary considerably from about ninety pounds to over two hundred and fifty pounds per week with the average wage being about one hundred and fifty pounds. A{new quarry}was to be built this year but they had problems so it is hoped to start in{1986,}and they should start digging for stone in 1987 or 1988. At the new quarry there will be about 30 lorry drivers, 72 people working on the quarry and about 28 office staff.
